newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia VSM plans 150 bln rbls bond issue in March.
newsitem.headline: Russia VSM plans 150 bln rbls bond issue in March.

text.p: RAO Vysokoskorstnye Magistrali (VSM or High-Speed Railways) plans to make a third 150 billion rouble ($26.5 million) one-year government-backed bond issue at the start of March, a company official said on Wednesday.
"We are sending the documents to the Finance Ministry today," VSM financial director Andrei Nikandrov told Reuters. "The exact date of the issue will be set at the start of next week."
VSM is raising funds to build a high-speed railway from Moscow to St. Petersburg.
Its bonds are Russia's only government-backed corporate paper.
The securities are effectively the same as Russia's OFZ interest-bearing bonds. OFZ bonds pay quarterly interest linked to current issues of GKO discount Treasury bills.
VSM's first two bond issues amounted to 120 billion and 240 billion roubles.
Environmentalists oppose the multi-billion dollar project as the route is supposed to cross several national parks.
